intro: Famatina cisandina, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, often in rocky or alpine environments. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy inflorescences that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens in cooler climates.
